name: Jonathan Pettus
text:
I'm not satisfied because I ordered an alternator on Wednesday around 11am. Was told it would arrive around noon on the next day, Christmas eve day. I called and was told it had not been ordered. I'm a disabled kidney dialysis patient and I depend on this little truck to get me to the dialysis center. I had to re-order the alternator and I have to wait until Monday after Christmas before I can get the truck fixed. This is only the most recent issue from this store I've experienced. Please, can someone hire a more competent employee....  UPDATE ... I called again on Monday after Christmas and was told that they ordered a starter by mistake. I  can not believe the incompetence of the employees here.

It seems that the responder to this post has also failed to pay attention. Is this a company wide incompetence? In the future I would suggest using other automotive parts dealers. No, i have not gotten the alternator yet. But I do hope the other store i ordered from has the correct part. I am planning on picking it up today.

resp.text: We apologize for any inconvenience caused by our Opp location with the ordering of your alternator. It sounds as if they have handled it correctly now but feel free to keep us updated. We will be forwarding your review to the Field Leadership of the store so they can see how their customers feel about the service provided and address it as needed. We hope to see you return and thank you for choosing Advance.

name: Teresa Alexander
text: Worst experience ever!  My husband went in and got an estimate to rent a backhoe but was talked into a dozer.  The quote was for $2400.  So, he sent me the next week to rent it and at that time the price went up to $2800.  So, my husband took off work to use it On A Thursday, Friday, Saturday, Sunday & Monday.  But, they didn’t bring it out until 2:00 pm on Thursday when it was supposed to be there early that morning.  He called and they give him the run around.  So, when he finished with it, he called them to come and get it and left it on 3/4 of a tank of fuel.  So after two weeks they finally came to get it and charged us over $2900.  The guy told my husband that the extra was for fuel when he left it with more fuel than it had to begin with which was a half tank.  The guy that brought it out, dropped it off and handed him a paper to sign.  So apparently that paper said that it had a full tank but my husband didn’t get time to confirm it.  So their response was sir you signed the paper.  All I can say is crooked!  We will not do business with them again.  Also, if we had gotten the backhoe we could have did what we needed to do but was talked out of it.

resp.text: Mrs. Alexander, we were sorry to hear about your recent experience at our rental store location in Huntsville. We informed the rental manager immediately upon learning about your experience and hearing your concerns. Our rental store manager reached out to your husband recently to talk to him and help make things right. We hope that is the first step in many to earning your trust and business back. If we can do anything else please don’t hesitate to reach out.

text: I was down there renting a piece of equipment from there and the older guy at the counter was nice and polite but the young guy working on the counter was rude and used  dirty  language I have never felt so disrespected in my life that will be the last time I use them and I wouldn’t recommend them to anyone cause robin rents has a lot better customer service and they would never treat anyone like they treated me

resp.text:
Just figured out who this is, Nickolas Forrester (goes by Nick) came to pickup from our store a piece of equipment for another contractor.  Nick was on the wrong side of the counter leaning against our cash drawer while we were in a rush.  Nobody "used dirty language" towards him, we asked him to move to the other side of the counter where the customers stand and Nick blew up on us.  We asked him to please leave the store if he could not act appropriately.  He then went outside to get loaded and started cursing at the guys on the yard.  We have several witnesses, including customers that we in the store during the exchange.  The contractor he was working for has been notified and Mr Nick is no longer allowed to come into our store.
We do not allow customers to verbally abuse our employees who are just doing their jobs and do not put up with it, period.  We are a family owned, christian business.

name: Zane Slocumb
text: The 50' lift I rented had not been well maintained and/or inspected before was rented to me. The electric motor had only a 6 hour charge on it at the time of rental, the gasoline engine would not start, and two bolts to secure part of the boom that is NOT supposed to slide were missing which lead to other problems that required some improvisation and resulted in the task taking much longer than it would have if everything had been in working order. I showed and explained the problems to their personnel, but no offer for any discount was made, apparently because I was still able to get the done over the weekend. I returned the lift with a full charge and my improvisation still in place so they could see what I did.

resp.text:
Let us begin by expressing how sorry we are that you had issues with the 50' tow behind lift that you had rented.  I would like to address the 6 hour run time on the lift.  With those lifts, that is very standard run time before the lift needs to be recharged.  Our counter sales reps should of made you aware of this at the beginning of the rental, and if there was no communication by our staff on that then you have my full apologies, and that will be addressed internally.  The engine is not meant to run the machine, but to charge the batteries when no power is available.  We have since fixed the engine to make sure we offer that additional feature.
We strive to be the premier equipment rental company in Huntsville and really thank you for your review.  The other issues raised are being addressed internally as well to make sure we are putting quality products out to the general public for rental.   We hope to see you again in the future!!

name: Bryan Carmean
text:
I have rented on 3 separate occasions from Valley Rental & up till today I could have honestly provided 5 stars. I was always treated with great personalities and their equipment is adequate  with great rates. However, after today I can honestly say I will never rent with them again and would advise other DIY’ers to steer clear. The issue is that there is no way to hold the company accountable if there's an issue. Unlike Robin Rents, United Rentals, etc the buck stops at valley so if the owner disagrees with your personality then you lose.
I rented a small mini backhoe to do some yard work for a 4 hour overnight rental with the intention of possibly keeping it for the weekend. Unfortunately the equipment was rented out  with no working brakes outside of the hydro static system itself. With that being said while attempting to switch from low to high gear the tractor got stuck in neutral and began to run away out of control an was unable to reduce the speed due to a complete absence of a manual functioning brake. This quickly escalated into a very bad situation which forced me to dive the back hoe bucket into my asphalt driveway (scoring It indefinitely) in order to prevent a potential disaster on a 3k plus lb. piece of equipment.
Needless to say I am not one to complain which is where I messed up. I received a call this afternoon from Ross who asked why the tractor was not returned @ 0900. This immediately infuriated me as I had explained the day before I would likely be keeping it for the weekend. The situation got completely out of control after explaining the incident that had occurred with the faulty tractor. To be fair he was prompt on offering a mechanic to come look at the unit but protested my explanation of the brake system and pointed blame. To make matters worse they literally had to call the local Kubota dealer to verify the brake system characteristics. I found this out by calling Kubota myself to verify this myself and was informed by Kubota that Valley Rental had them. After this I decided I wanted nothing more to do with their equipment and lies and called to have them just pick up the tractor and be done with it. Upon contact another argument took place with myself and Ross which led to Ross cursing and using profanity at me and hanging up the phone after stating he was sending someone to get his tractor. At this point I have no idea what I am even being charged and no one I can talk to verify how to resolve this issue as the GM himself will just hang up on you. All in all I find it very frustrating that there is no way to hold Valley Rentals accountable for their actions. The problem is at the top and not the solution like larger rental facilities that you can hold accountable. They did by no request of myself refund a portion of my rental (1 hour of use and 3 ½ gallons of fuel to be exact). They did not even offer to repair the driveway and Ross never apologized for his professionalism & disrespect & I of all people know professionalism being a 10 year disabled combat Vet. Honestly, the majority of Valley Rental is spot on. But with situations like these customers can be taken advantage of and have no avenues of recourse. All in all I say rent at your own discretion and hopefully nothing goes wrong because if it does your on your own. Otherwise be smart and rent only from organizations that can and will hold themselves accountable for their mistakes and lack of communication.
I assume they will rebuttal against this review, possibly even with an apology from Ross. However, if the GM wanted to correct the issue it would have been done prior to me posting this review and in a timely manner. At this point an apologize given due to a public review is nothing more than an attempt to discredit the review and salvage other/ new  customer relationships that may be harmed by my sharing of a real world experience in order to prevent others from experiencing similar stressful & unsafe situations

resp.text:
Mr. Carmean, we are very sorry you feel the way you do. We believe the entire situation could have been avoided with better, calmer communication.
On May 11th, Mr. Carmean rented a mini backhoe.  He had informed the counter that he was paying for a half day/overnight rental and that he might extend out to a day to 2 days.  His rental expired at a half day at 8am and, as a company policy, we reached out to see how long he wanted to extend. This communication upset Mr. Carmean, to an unreasonable degree.
At that point, he informed us of the situation that occurred with the brakes of the mini backhoe.  As he described his situation the first conclusion, based on the information given, the machine was put into neutral and gathered speed going down a driveway and the parking brake system, which is used to hold the machine in place, not stop it when going that speed, did not stop the customer.  We then stated that we wanted to check the machine and wanted to send a mechanic out to make sure the machine was safe to use, per company policy.  We simply wanted our experienced mechanic to inspect the machine and determine what was going on.  These are hydrostatic machines and are not meant to go downhill in neutral, taking the machine out of the hydrostatic operating system and forcing it into neutral, to gain speed, can cause harm to the machine, and most importantly, the operator.
With the situation and Mr. Carmean, calmed down, our mechanic in route, the customer called the local Kubota dealership and asked if Kubota machines had brakes. Without knowing what machine the customer was referring to, the situation that occurred, etc.  they answered with a general statement of, “Yes, Kubota machines have brakes.”  The customer then called us back and was irate again calling everyone liars.   We were informed, by our Kubota dealer, when Kubota tried to reach out to him again, from someone actually in service, not just someone answering the phone, that Mr. Carmean would not let the Kubota Service manager get a word in and continued to verbally abuse him as well.
It is our company policy to educate our customers on the use of a machine before we allow them to leave our store with it. On the back side of our rental agreement, we address the inspection of the equipment, use of the equipment and the customer’s responsibility in an of emergency or equipment malfunction. Mr Carmean agreed to and signed this contract. Despite the fact, he did not follow our guidelines regarding the proper usage of the machine or the guidelines when an accident occurred, we did not charge him any extra and actually refunded him for the time he did not use.
While we don’t like to have unhappy customers, as we base our business on customer service, we also won’t allow customers to verbally abuse our staff.

name: Tom Stofer
text: I went to the Dadeville, AL, AutoZone Auto Parts store on Monday, Jan. 6, to purchase a battery for my lawn tractor. They had the battery I wanted but the shelf date was several months old. I asked a store employee if their batteries were routinely rotated and he said they were. The employee further told me that their delivery truck would be there on Wednesday. He seemed to indicate the truck would bring newer dated batteries. I left my name and number but never got a call. The following Monday I visited the store again and spoke to the same employee. He checked and said they didn't get any newer batteries in. He said he was going to the Alexander City store that afternoon and would see if they had a newer battery. He again said he would call me either way and let me know. I confirmed that he still had the note with my name and number. And again he never called. I sent an email to AutoZone's national website regarding their lack of customer service. They replied and said that my email was being forwarded to the district manager and that I would be contacted within 24 to 48 hours. That didn't happen either. I sent a second email to AutoZone letting them know that the district manager never contacted me. They said my second email was also forwarded to the district manager.A day or two later the district manager finally attempted to contact me. But by then I had already purchased a battery at O'Rielly's Auto Parts where, I must say, I received much better customer service.

resp.text: This is not the impression we want to leave, Tom. We're disappointed to hear you did not have a great experience with our team. We strive to help you in any way we can with your automotive needs. Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We are always improving and hope you give us another chance to win back your trust and confidence.

name: Donnie Coleman
text:
Filed on : January 30 2014

Filed by :
Donald Coleman
359 South Montcrest
Cullman AL 35057

Filed against :
Stewart Auto Supply, Inc.
1211 Loring Nw
Cullman AL 35055

Complaint Description:
worst machine work i have seen in my life ,and the machinist is rude and not willing to make things right. Took my 6.0 LQ4 block, crank and heads to have them reworked, cleaned and check to see if they were still within spec limits. We discussed engine gaskets rebuild kits. I left and then called on the phone to discuss more pricing and gaskets again. I went back to stewarts to bring some more parts to be cleaned but on that visit talked again about rebuild kits and gaskets. Now each time i talked to the owner about the gasket sets i asked, were they felpro? his answer every time was yes they will be felpro. He gave me a price which was little more then what i had search online for but i decided to go with his kit since the gaskets were definitely felpro . well is snowed the next day and roads were closed so i had to wait another day for him to finish. roads were still bad so he came in late but he was finished around lunch time. So when i get there to pick up my parts i ask where is the rebuild kit. The machinist shows me the box and the gaskets sets are not felpro, they are Victor reins gaskets. I refused to buy the kit because he told me a they would contain felpro. The machinist told me that felpro and victor reins were made by the same company that they were the exact same gaskets. That was his first lie too me. Those are two entirely different companys, with different pricing and materials. so we deducted the kit and now i owe for the machine work done, which is 345.00 I pay the balance go home and start unloading the block and notice the cam bearing that they installed for me were damaged from the installation too. Took it back and the owner said he doesn't know any other way to put those bearings in. well duh!!! but you don't damage them when they go in , if you do damage them then you take them out and install new ones. but they sent me home with that crap. so i decided to look over the heads real good since things are already not good. well the heads are aluminum heads , they look as if someone took a wire brush to clean the mating surfaces on the heads. they are scratched badly. there are several scratches going across the from one cylinder to the other which will leak when it is installed back on the block. So i took the heads back to stewarts this morning and asked to talk to someone about this and the owner wasn't there but the machinist was. so i showed the head to the machinist and asked what he did to it. he said he milled it. i asked is that acceptable? he said yes. i asked if he could show me any where in writing, online or any mechanic that can tell me that those scratches on the mating surface of the head was acceptable .The machinist looked at me and said pick my head up and get the hell out of there. You can imagine what my response was. :) but I'm not happy with this and the place of business is just horrible. I have been building engines for over 23 years and i have never seen anyone tell me that scratches on a aluminum head was acceptable to install. They refused to take of this and now i have to take the heads and have them resurfaced if they can even be resurfaced again. i also heve to take the block and crank to another machine shop to have them check and correct everything stewarts touched. BEWARE SHOTTY WORK AND BAD CUSTOMER SERVICE. STAY AWAY if you want good work performed.

Your Desired Resolution:
At this point all i want is a complete refund for the services they performed. I tried to go back to talk to them and i was told to get the hell out of their store. The work performed was bad and i don't fell comfortable letting them touch anything else of mine.

name: Rachel Lee
text:
Gave an extra start because whoever answered the phone had the decency to accept fault for an issue, and was polite.

Placed order online, and received an email that the order is ready for pickup. So, I drove from C'burg (past the AutoZone that said they are out of stock online) to Sylacauga, only to be told that the parts I ordered were not in stock, despite the notification that they WERE in stock.

Rather than calling me and letting me know, they issued a refund. Refund will take 3 to 5 business days to hit my card. I'm down to a couple dollars in the bank, I used my last bit of money for parts to fix a car for work.

Had they actually called me and let me know it's not in stock and not to make the drive, I would have requested they order the parts and I'd come pick them up tomorrow. But now, I'm broke for the next week. I can't even order the parts.

Please, PLEASE Autozone, next time this happens to someone, call them IMMEDIATELY and let them know, and ask them if they'd prefer a refund or to order the parts. Your customer should decide what should be done with their money.

resp.text: We're sorry for the inconvenience, Rachel. Professionalism is a priority for us, so we're sorry we weren't able to let you know. We strive to keep our stores well-stocked with a wide selection of products to support your automotive needs and get you back on the road. We're continuously improving and we hope you check us out again.

text: Worst experience I’ve ever had in my life!! To begin with the Hoover store gave us the completely wrong part. We stop at the store in Calera to get the correct part. The manager Derrick was snarky and rude. Told us we bought “cheap brakes” and needed to buy the $64 ones instead. Then I try to just try to return. There was a customer in front of me taking a while and offered to let me go ahead. The worker refused. Then when it was my turn, I tried to return the brakes. The worker spent time trying to look up the part just to reiterate that it was the wrong part. I told him I wasn’t even purchasing new brakes, just returning those. I told him at least 10 times I bought it from Hoover. 5 minutes later he refused to return the wrong part because I didn’t purchase it at his store and stated “I wish you told me that sooner”. Too bad you can’t give a 0 Star review.

text:
I would not recommend this store to my worst enemy.  I am from out of town and I had my brake lights malfunction.  I stopped at this store to see if they could help me out and what I got was NOTHING.  I didn't expect them to fix it or even look at it.  I just needed some direction and what I got was a "we can't help you".  I went down the street to NAPA auto parts where the guy working in there checked my fuse for me and replaced it for me.  Advance needs to take some customer service lessons from NAPA.
I very rarely write negative reviews for retail businesses because I worked in retail management for years and I understand that things happen but this was beyond rude and I will always use NAPA going forward.

name: Dorothy Adams
text: I asked the young gentleman at the Counter if they helped replace headlight bulbs. He said depends on the car- so he came and checked it out. Help me find the bulb that was needed, replaced in no time! He had me check my high beams and low beams- said all four of headlights were working- (it took him a second) though to say that. (That should have been a red flag right then for me).Well I gave him a small tip for helping me out. I went to leave and looking at the lights shining on the door it did not look like all four were working but I had somewhere else to be and was already running behind. I said I would check it out when I got to my next stop- sure enough they were not working. I am mad at myself for not addressing it then! I called back the next morning and talked to the young man and he said “all four were working when you were here.” I explained how the minute he walked away- I didn’t think it was right but it’s my fault for not addressing it right then! I am supposed to stop by and see the manager today— so we shall see what the outcome is! Lesson learned for me!

resp.text: This is not the impression we should leave, Dorothy. It is never our intent to deceive or mislead as we value all our customers. Please send us an email at customer.reviews@autozone.com so we can make things right. We hope we can regain your trust and confidence.

name: Trevor Joiner
text: Advance Auto is my go-to store for all things automotive. Tonight, I visited not for automotive needs but guitar needs. I'm a luthier (I build, repair, and restore guitars) and tonight I needed a fine polish to restore the gloss to the lacquer of an old 70s guitar. They didn't have what I was looking for (Meguire's Mirror Glaze #9) but the guy was super, super helpful and friendly. The friendly service, competitive prices, and amazing savings when using coupons for online purchases are why I will come to Advance again and again.

text: I ordered online and went inside for pickup. All the workers were polite and helpful. I didn't have to wait long to get what I had order, and they even help me find a tool I wasn't able to find on the website!

name: Michaela Carter
text: I went in to get an oil filter for my car and told them exactly what I needed. Well the lady rang up the wrong filter and I didn’t recognize it til I paid and picked up the bag and it was way to heavy. I told her that was the wrong one we got it corrected. I paid almost $18 for that and I knew the one I normally get is only around $10-11. So she gets the receipt and is scanning it to refund the difference and i thought it was completed so as I am walking out I check the receipt and nothing was refunded. I go to the back double check the pricing before saying anything went to the front to advise her there was nothing refunded. She proceeded to tell me that I seemed to be in a hurry so she was going to let me go ahead and go but in order to refund the difference I had to swipe my card again. So if you have anything with a price difference to be refunded make sure it actually happens and you get the receipt.

resp.text: Michaela, we apologize for the lack of attention regarding your whole visit to our Muscle Shoals location. Your feedback has been forwarded to the Field Leadership team of this store and they will address any additional training that may be needed. When you come in with exact details of what you want, that should be what you get. We hope that that you do give the store another chance in the future to provide you the proper experience. Thank you for shopping with Advance Auto Parts.

resp.text: Hello Kevin, thank you for taking the time to leave this review! Here at Advance, we aim to provide exceptional service to all of our customers, and we're sorry to learn that your visit to our Muscle Shoals location resulted in a 1 star rating. Unfortunately, we cannot offer installation of headlight bulbs, however we do provide this service for wiper blades. We did make contact with this store, and unfortunately they were unfamiliar with this incident. We certainly apologize for any inconveniences this may have caused you, and hope for another opportunity to earn your business. Thank you for shopping with Advance Auto Parts and Batteries, we look forward to seeing you again!

name: KJ MullinZ
text:
🔥Workers involved:
MIKE (Store Manager)
THOMAS D. (Employee)
Date of incident: 2/20/21 - 4:30-5:00pm.

🔥Bought a refurbished starter from there a few years ago. Returned it because it went bad and had a warranty. Did not want to deal with another refurbished starter, so I requested a brand new one. Was told they cannot get a brand new one which is fine. So they told me I could return the defective refurbished starter I had for a refund so I can use that refund on buying a new starter from another store. At that time, that particular employee was real helpful and kind to me.

Then the incident on 2/20/21 happened when I returned on that date with my defective starter. was dealing with the store manager Mike and his employee Thomas D. at the time. I was told that the starter needed to test bad in order for me to get a refund which is fine, because I had my mechanic test the starter beforehand and I recorded a video as evidence. After waiting a good few minutes because it seemed like something was wrong with the machine, the store manager Mike comes out and says that the starter tested good, but that he would still honor the refund. I told him that's fine, but the starter should have tested bad because my mechanic already tested it and I watched him test it, so I pretty much told Mike that the machine is to blame, then he got defensive and rude with his tone of voice about the machine clearly stating that the machine was not incorrect. To avoid further debating, I directly said to just do the refund. His attitude regarding the situation was unprofessional and unacceptable.

What makes the situation even worse is the fact that the employee Thomas D. asked me for my driver's license on returning the defective starter which should not have happened, because I have my receipt. When I asked him why he's asking for my driver's license, he said they were supposed to do that on returns, but that's obviously not true. Something didn't feel right, so I called another advance Auto parts store about the situation and that store told me that advance auto of Enterprise were in the wrong for taking my driver's license. My driver's license has the address to my Mother's home because it's an old address and I am not comfortable with that address being on file because I'm protective of my mother and concerned for her safety. I do not trust people I don't know, and I definitely do not trust that advance Auto parts store anymore and ever again.

They acted very shady and I felt discriminated because I'm part Asian. I've been shopping there off and on for years for myself and for my Mother. As of now, I am no longer a customer and I want my information out of that system immediately. Yes, I got my refund, but I shouldn't have had to go through that much trouble to get it, or feel that uncomfortable. Everything that happened that day was pretty much recorded on my phone along with two eyewitnesses that were with me in case I need them for future reference.

resp.text: Hello KJ, thank you for leaving your comments about your visit to our Enterprise location. We have forwarded your concerns to the store leadership and apologize for the experience you had. In no way does Advance Auto condone discrimination and we will be investigating the allegations. Please feel free to reach out to our customer service department at 877-238-2623 to provide any more information and thank you for choosing Advance Auto.

text: First three kids on Sunday told my sister to use channel locks instead of a line wrench to do the job line wrenches are designed to do, take off, and reinstall break lines. They seriously told her, then me, use channel locks, or vise grips! My reply was, uh, somebody Else might want to work on the break lines at some point!!! Then the next day, the grouchy old guy ringing us up for the correct parts, refused to give me my military discount, even though I had my VA card, and had mentioned it before he finished the transaction! For crying out loud, it was applied to the first purchase, that was returned because they were the wrong dang parts! I'm sorry, but after my third visit to this store, I'll drive to the fairhope store, Foley store, or Robertsdale store before I'll go to this store ever again, it was as bad as the one in Mobile.

resp.text: This is never the impression we should leave, Darryl. Being knowledgeable about auto parts and providing the best customer experience is what AutoZone is all about. We're disappointed we let you down. We're always listening to our customers and making improvements. We hope you give us another chance in the future to take care of your automotive needs. Thank you for sharing your experience.
